Hello @arnov! Thanks for updating the PR.







Cheers ! There are no PEP8 issues in this Pull Request. :beers: 

##### Comment last updated on February 15, 2019 at 12:32 Hours UTC

> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25304?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [53281a5...ec1fa9f](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25304?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

Thanks for the PR! 
See my comment here https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/issues/25299#issuecomment-463394298, I think we should separately try to fix it using `numeric_only` (would you want to do that here?), and then think about deprecating it (see https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/issues/25303)

@arnov Thanks for the updates! 
But, as I said above, I think it would be better to keep the numeric_only fix, and the deprecation separate. The deprecation is only for 0.25.0, but the regression fix would be good to include in version 0.24.2

@jorisvandenbossche yes, sorry! I've made this one simpler and kept only the fix for numeric_only. I've kept the other changes in another branch, so could make a separate PR out of that after this one is done.

Two further questions:

- can you add a note in the 0.24.2 whatsnew file? (in the regression section)
- workflow related: in general, we prefer that you push new commits to a PR, instead of squashing/amending a previous commit and force pushing. That way it makes it easier to eg see what changed since a last review (in this case not that important of course since it is a very small diff), and we squash/merge PRs in the end anyway, so it is no problem that there are multiple (unclean) commits in the PR branch.

Moving this discussion out of the review comment (https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25304#discussion_r257208313) to keep it easier to follow. 
Discussion is about where to add the special casing for the `numeric_only` keyword for Categorical: in `Series._reduce` or in `Categorical`. Adding it in `Series._reduce` is less clean (but only temporary), but moving it to `Categorical` would mean that the `EA._reduce` in general needs to accept (and ignore) the `numeric_only`. Which would be an API change.

But to take a step back: @jreback do you agree that in the _long term_ we can deprecate this `numeric_only` keyword for Categorical.min/max?
(it's the only EA that now uses it, while the others all use `skipna` for the same thing)

> But to take a step back: @jreback do you agree that in the _long term_ we can deprecate this `numeric_only` keyword for Categorical.min/max?
(it's the only EA that now uses it, while the others all use `skipna` for the same this

not sure what you mean here. The ``numeric_only`` kwarg is pretty generic an ingrained. I think you need to accept it for ``Catetogorical`` and either ignore it or handle it. EA's can choose to respond to this or not. But this is a higher level operation, applying to each array in turn.
Again, please read  #25303, and respond there is you don't agree or don't understand the reasoning. This is *not* about the general `numeric_only` keyword.

OK, so we agree that, in the long term, we want to deprecate and remove `numeric_only` from `Categorical.min/max`.

To fix the regression (what this PR is doing), we still have to deal with this special case until it is finally removed. 
So either we need to *change* the public API of `EA._reduce`, or either we agree to have the special case in `Series._reduce` (we are talking about *two lines* of code), which is what this PR is doing.

Changing the public API will lead to more changes internally than 2 lines, but moreover is something we should IMO not do for a bug fix release. So @jreback short-term proposal: we do it as in this PR for 0.24.2, and discuss / re-work it for 0.25.0 ?

> Changing the public API will lead to more changes internally than 2 lines, but moreover is something we should IMO not do for a bug fix release. So @jreback short-term proposal: we do it as in this PR for 0.24.2, and discuss / re-work it for 0.25.0 

that's extra work, just mark this for 0.25.0 and let's fix properly. I don't think this is very hard to fix anyhow. ``_reduce`` already accepts kwargs IIRC.
@jreback can we move the discussion to gitter if you have a moment?
